intro: Zeuxine hoshiana, commonly known as the Japanese false dragonhead, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Zeuxine hoshiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
